title: Lesson 1 – The Strange Playground
scene: Late afternoon. Two friends arrive at the playground. It feels normal... but kind of like when a game starts glitching. Something's off.

script.speaker: A
script.text: Hey, you’re here! I thought I’d be alone.

script.speaker: B
script.text: Yeah… I'm not alone now, but I’m kinda [nervous].

script.speaker: B
script.text: I know, but it doesn’t [*feel*] ok. Like a lag before the boss fight.

script.speaker: A
script.text: Hmm. Is there something behind the [slide]?

script.speaker: B
script.text: Maybe. There’s a [shadow]. Or… maybe I’m just scared.

script.speaker: A
script.text: No way. I'm scared too. Let’s check it together.

script.speaker: B
script.text: Okay. You go first. I’m not ready.

script.speaker: B
script.text: Then… we go together. Ready or not… here we go.

twist: There’s something glowing under the swing.
You hear a voice whisper: “Time's almost up…”
Your phone buzzes: no signal. Just one word: RUN.
The ball floats. Someone (or something) is holding it.
